seriesstmt.p: Portions of this collection are part of New England's Hidden Histories. Digital historical representations of these portions of the collection can be viewed online.

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday September 28, 2020 at 15:13

did.abstract: The Congregational Church of Wendell was formed in Wendell, Mass. on November 29, 1774. The Wendell, Mass. Congregational Church records document the history, administration, and life of the church and its members from its inception through the 1950s. Types of records present include extensive financial records, church and society meeting minutes, correspondence, and important earyy vital statistics for the church and its members.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Wendell, Mass. Congregational Church records, 1783-1953, RG4890. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Records received in 2004. No additional acquisition information is available for this collection.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additional accruals are expected for this collection in the form of full-text transcription. There is no anticipated date for this accrual.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Originally processed in 2008 by Kimberly Kinder. Minimally re-processed and updated for ArchiveSpace by Zachary Bodnar, October 2017, using DACS Second Edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Congregational Church of Wendell was formed in Wendell, Mass. on November 29, 1774. The first meeting house was built in 1783, and a second in 1846. Throughout the collection the church is referred to by several names, including Church of Christ, First Church, Central Congregational Church in Wendell, and the Congregational Church of Wendell. The Trustees of the Ministerial Fund of the First Congregational Society in Wendell were incorporated in 1823 to carry out their function for the church. A copy of the articles of their incorporation is pasted inside the front cover of their minute book. On December 2, 1874 the church and the town of Wendell celebrated their centennial with a joint event.

Even though the church was relatively small throughout its history, the Congregational Church of Wendell contributed to domestic and foreign missions, including mission work in China. The church belonged to the Franklin Association of Congregational Churches and worked closely with the Massachusetts Home Missionary Society to call and fund its ministers. In later years the church shared its minister with a church in the nearby town of Erving. In the course of its history, the Congregational Church in Wendell had many different ministers. Rev. Edmund Blackmer is documented more thoroughly than any other minister that served the church because of a nervous disorder that forced him to delay accepting the church's call for almost two full years, from the fall of 1918 to the spring of 1920. Another minister of note is Rev. Harlan P. Metcalf , who died in the office of minister, leaving behind the text of a sermon intended to be preached on Mother's Day, included in this collection. Also worthy of note is Mrs. Effie Bowen, who served as the clerk of the Congregational Church in Wendell for more than 30 years in the early 1900s.
The Congregational Church of Wendell joined the United Church of Christ in 1964 and folded in 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Wendell, Mass. Congregational Church records document the history, administration, and life of the church and its members from its inception through the 1950s. This collection includes financial material in many forms, including ledger and treasury books, account books, receipts and correspondence from individuals and agencies. Records of church business and personnel are preserved in formal record books, minute books, loose records and correspondence. Correspondence includes letters of dismissal and acceptance of congregants, letters from ministers accepting and relinquishing their posts and letters to the church clerk.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series, the first of which has been further arranged into five sub-series. Each series and subseries has been arranged chronologically by start date, when possible, and, further, by topic.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: To access digital user's copies via online-interface, a java-enabled web browser is required. Internet Explorer 8.x and later, Firefox 5.x and later, Opera 12 and later, Safari 5.x and later, or any version of Google Chrome are recommended.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Parish and Personnel records cover the administrative, personnel, and written history of the Congregational Church of Wendell and its environs. Types of materials present include personal and official correspondence, vital statistics such as membership certificates, baptismal records, and records of death, society minutes, resignations, and historical sketches of the town of Wendell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Church and Society records cover official church business such as church correspondence and meeting minutes. Types of materials present include annual meeting minutes, church correspondence, ecclesiastical council minutes, baptismal records, death records, marriage records, Society minutes, general and parish meeting minutes, and administrative documents.

did.unittitle: Records of the First Church in Wendell

altformavail.head: Digital Copies
altformavail.p: These church records were digitized as part of the New England's Hidden Histories project. Digital reproductions are available to view online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Records of the First Church in Wendell is the first of two bound volumes of handwritten records that cover a broad range of topics related to the administration of the church as well as the happenings of the church ministers and members. Types of materials present in the volume include records related to the creation of a "religious Profession," meeting minutes, records of votes, a list of founding members of the church, records of birth, records of admission, records from the deacons, records of dismission, baptismal records, marriage records, records of death, public confessions of guilt, annual birth and death statistics, church contributions, and copies of church correspondence.

did.unittitle: Records of the First Church in Wendell
First Congregational Society in Wendell minutes
Correspondence from China Mission and donations
Correspondence regarding geneological searches at Wendell

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Vital Statistics of the Congregational Church of Wendell include church membership records, certificates of membership and dismission, and baptismal records.

did.unittitle: Letters of dismission and acceptance of church members
Letters of dismission and acceptance of church members

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Pastoral records cover the official and personal records of the ministers of the Congregational Church of Wendell. Types of materials present include official summons, pastoral correspondence, pastoral calls, letters of resignation, and missionary correspondence.

did.unittitle: Correspondence from Massachusetts Home Missionary Society
Correspondence of Pastoral Calls and Resignations
Correspondence of Pastoral Calls and Resignations
Rev. Edmund F. Blackmer Correspondence with Wendell
Correspondence to Rev. Arthur Green regarding 100th Anniversary Celebration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Church Services records include a booklet for lawyers of church organizations, the published constitution of the Franklin Association, a Mother's Day sermon, and Sunday Service pamphlets.

did.unittitle: Rev. Harlan P. Metcalf Mother's Day sermon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Church and Town History records cover historical sketches and other documents related to the history of the town of Wendell and the Congregational Church of Wendell. Types of materials present include brief historical sketches, historical records from the clerk, and a typed manuscript for the 150th anniversary of the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Church Finances records cover the extensive financial documents of the Congregational Church of Wendell. Types of materials present include church ledgers, treasury records, collection records, grants, assessment records, account records, and promissory notes.

altformavail.head: Digital Copies
altformavail.p: These church records were digitized as part of the New England's Hidden Histories project. Digital reproductions are available to view online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Parish Treasury Book is a hardbound volume of financial records for the Congregational Church of Wendell. Types of materials present within the volume include finance committee reports, account balances, records of transactions, salary records, and tax records.
